metadata.title: CVE-2018-10861 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way ceph mon handles user requests. Anyauthenticated ceph user having read access to ceph can delete, create cephstorage pools and corrupt snapshot images. Ceph branches master, mimic,luminous and jewel are believed to be affected.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10861` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
ceph-base - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
ceph-common - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
ceph-fuse - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
ceph-mds - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
ceph-mgr - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
ceph-mon - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
ceph-osd - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
ceph-resource-agents - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
ceph-test - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libcephfs-java - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

python3-cephfs - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
python3-rados - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
python3-rbd - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
python3-rgw - 12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '12.2.7-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
